mdRecord.dcterms:title: Rand McNally official 1922 auto trails map, District number 20
Auto trails map, district number 20
Official 1922 auto trails map, district number 20
Official Roanoke map
Official map Roanoke Auto. Assn., 1922
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Rand McNally and Company.
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 63 x 81 cm. on sheet 68 x 87 cm., folded in cover 19 x 11 cm. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Lee Highway (Route 11) and other routes to Roanoke, Virginia highlighted in red.
Southern Ohio, West Virginia, Virginia, southern Maryland, southern Delaware, North Carolina, South Carolina, northern Georgia, eastern Alabama, eastern Tennessee and eastern Kentucky.
On verso: "Official Roanoke map" with 4 Roanoke distance tables and 13 business advertisements.
Text of Virginia "Act requiring all vehicles to stop before crossing railway tracks at grade" (effective June 19, 1922) on p. [4] of cover.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Transferred from Virginia ephemera file, 2000. Note special filing location.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Roads--Southern States--Maps.
Southern States--Maps, Tourist.
Roanoke (Va.)--Maps.
Virginia--Maps.
